articles.headline: Fed Plans to Vet Banker Pay to Discourage Risky Practices
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve announced a plan to scrutinize pay packages at banks and deter rewards for reckless pursuit of short-term profits.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve announced a plan to scrutinize pay packages at banks and deter rewards for reckless pursuit of short-term profits.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve announced Thursday that it would crack down on pay packages that encouraged bankers to take excessive risks, but officials acknowledged that the plan might not reduce the biggest paychecks on Wall Street.

articles.headline: U.S. Arrests Hundreds in Raids on Drug Cartel
articles.snippet: Attorney General Eric Holder described a series of raids in 19 states to fight a major Mexican drug organization.
articles.abstract: Attorney General Eric Holder described a series of raids in 19 states to fight a major Mexican drug organization.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON  Staging raids in 19 states, the Justice Department struck this week at one of Mexico’s most ruthless drug-trafficking organizations, a cultlike group known as La Familia Michoacana and notorious for beheading its enemies.

articles.headline: The Cell Refuseniks, an Ever-Shrinking Club
articles.snippet: Some 85 percent of adult Americans have cellphones. The rest have strategies for living without this tool.
articles.abstract: Some 85 percent of adult Americans have cellphones. The rest have strategies for living without this tool.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not so long ago, we all lived in a world in which we decided where to meet friends before leaving the house and we hiked to the nearest payphone if we got a flat tire. Then we got cellphones.

articles.headline: Research Uproar at a Cancer Clinic
articles.snippet: A federal investigation found evidence supporting a whistle-blower’s claims, raising questions about methods at community research hospitals in the United States.
articles.abstract: A federal investigation found evidence supporting a whistle-blower’s claims, raising questions about methods at community research hospitals in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: URBANA, Ill.  Two years after becoming vice president for research at the biggest hospital in this university town, Suzanne Stratton said she had finally seen enough.

articles.headline: Pay Cuts, but Little Headway on Larger Goals
articles.snippet: Kenneth R. Feinberg may succeed in trimming back executive pay, but only shareholders can curtail greed in the corner offices.
articles.abstract: Kenneth R. Feinberg may succeed in trimming back executive pay, but only shareholders can curtail greed in the corner offices.
articles.lead_paragraph: And then the country’s pay czar descended from the mountaintop, or at least from his Washington law office, and handed down his rulings. And for his 175 subjects  er, I mean the 25 most highly paid executives at the seven big companies that still hold billions of dollars in government assistance  his rulings were painful.

articles.headline: Freddie Mac’s Secrecy Pacts Face Court Test
articles.snippet: Some former employees said they are eager to talk about the fraud case, but their severance packages say they cannot.
articles.abstract: Some former employees said they are eager to talk about the fraud case, but their severance packages say they cannot.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  One year after the government took over and bailed out Freddie Mac, the giant mortgage finance company, federal regulators are blocking former employees from revealing information to investors who are suing the company for fraud, lawyers for shareholders say.

articles.headline: A Lone Cleric Is Loudly Defying Iran’s Leaders
articles.snippet: The Iranian government has been able to intimidate most of its detractors, but not Mehdi Karroubi, its most tenacious and problematic critic.
articles.abstract: The Iranian government has been able to intimidate most of its detractors, but not Mehdi Karroubi, its most tenacious and problematic critic.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  A short midlevel cleric, with a neat white beard and a clergyman’s calm bearing, Mehdi Karroubi has watched from his home in Tehran in recent months as his aides have been arrested, his offices raided, his newspaper shut down. He himself has been threatened with arrest and, indirectly, the death penalty.

articles.headline: NATO Ministers Endorse Wider Afghan Effort
articles.snippet: The support for Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal’s strategy increased pressure to commit more military resources.
articles.abstract: The support for Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal’s strategy increased pressure to commit more military resources.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRATISLAVA, Slovakia  Defense ministers from NATO on Friday endorsed the ambitious counterinsurgency strategy for Afghanistan proposed by Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal, giving new impetus to his recommendation to pour more troops into the eight-year-old war.
articles.byline: By Thom Shanker and Mark Landler

articles.headline: Scrutinizing 2010 Insurance Options
articles.snippet: Companies change health insurance offerings each year, so open those envelopes and read the choices.
articles.abstract: Companies change health insurance offerings each year, so open those envelopes and read the choices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Whatever you do with your health benefits during the current open enrollment season for 2010, there’s a good chance it won’t be what you did last year.
